title: Drawing, "Law Courts, Naples, Wall", ca. 1750
medium:
Pen and black ink, gray wash, graphite
Support: ivory wove paper
inscribed: inscribed in pen and brown ink at lower center: Sala della Vicheria/ di Napoli dipinta da Gio. Batta. Natali; on verso in pen and brown ink: natali
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Law Courts, Naples, Wall", ca. 1750.
ca. 1750. Pen and black ink, gray wash, graphite
Support: ivory wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-25.
